question: 試合
sourceMnemonic: An <kanji>attempt</kanji> to <kanji>join</kanji> together isn't just any get together. Imagine two people boxing. They attempt to knock each other out when they join together. That's why this word is <vocabulary>game</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>match</vocabulary>. Did you watch the <ja>試合</ja> today? No! Don't tell me what happened, I recorded it on the VHS.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This word uses the on'yomi <ja>し</ja> for <ja>試</ja> and the kun'yomi <ja>あい</ja> for <ja>合</ja>, which you learned with <ja>場合</ja>. So you should be able to put them together!
